t: Job 18
Then*p answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
How*p long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.
Wherefore*p are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
He*p teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?
Yea,*p the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
The*p light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
The*p steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
For*p he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
The*p gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
The*p snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
Terrors*p shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
His*p strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
It*p shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
His*p confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
It*p shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
His*p roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
His*p remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
He*p shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
He*p shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
They*p that come after him shall be astonished at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
Surely*p such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
